```{r}
library(tidyverse)

library(dplyr)
 



#write a greeting function that saus "good morning", "good afternoon", "good evening" depending on the time of day 

greet <- function(time = lubridate::now(), name){
  hour <- parse_number(str_sub(time,12,13))
  if(hour < 12){
    cat("good morning", name)
    
  } else if (hour < 17){
    cat("good afternoon", name)
  }else {
    cat("good evening", name)
  }
}

greet("2023-01-01 12:12:12", "Othello")




#writing the fizzbuzz function: it takes a single number as input 



fizzbuzz <- function(x){
  if(x%%15 == 0){
    print("fizzbuzz")
  }else if(x%%3 == 0){
    print("fizz")
  }else if(x%%5 == 0){
    print("buzz")
  }else{
    print(x)
  }
}

fizzbuzz(33)
fizzbuzz(11)
fizzbuzz(15)
fizzbuzz(5)

```
